thread.title: Kansas City Royals defeat Toronto Blue Jays in MLB Playoffs 4-3, win pennant: Live recap, ALCS Game 6
thread.title_full: Kansas City Royals defeat Toronto Blue Jays in MLB Playoffs 4-3, win pennant: Live recap, ALCS Game 6 | OregonLive.com

author: JD Humburg | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Kansas City Royals defeat Toronto Blue Jays in MLB Playoffs 4-3, win pennant: Live recap, ALCS Game 6
text:
The Kansas City Royals defeated the Toronto Blue Jays 4-3 in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series to win their second consecutive AL pennant. The Royals will face the New York Mets in the 2015 World Series, which is scheduled to begin Tuesday in Kansas City.
Here's an inning-by-inning recap of how it happened:
9th inning - Russell Martin leads off with a single against Wade Davis. Dalton Pompey pinch runs and steals second and third base. Kevin Pillar walks to put two on with nobody out. But Davis strikes out pinch hitter Dioner Navarro, strikes out Ben Revere and gets potential AL MVP Josh Donaldson to ground out. Royals win the pennant. Royals 4, Blue Jays 3, final.
8th inning - An eventual inning. Blue Jays tie the score when Jose Bautista crushes a two-run homer off Kansas City reliever Ryan Madson. After a 45-minute rain delay, the Royals come to bat against Toronto closer Roberto Osuna. Lorenzo Cain leads off with a walk, and then he scores all the way from first base on a single by Eric Hosmer. Royals three outs from a return trip to the World Series. Royals 4, Blue Jays 3.
7th inning - Royals reliever Kelvin Herrera retires the side in order. Kansas City then gets a leadoff single from Mike Moustakas before Salvador Perez flies out deep to left on a great leaping catch by Blue Jays left fielder Ben Revere. Moustakas moves to second on a groundout by Alex Gordon, and Toronto manager John Gibbons decides to pull David Price for Aaron Sanchez, who immediately allows an RBI single to Alex Rios. Royals 3, Blue Jays 1.
6th inning - Blue Jays miss on another scoring opportunity when Edwin Encarnacion is stranded at second following a one-out double. Kelvin Herrera relieves Yordano Ventura and strikes out Chris Colabello for out No. 2 and gets Troy Tulowitzki to fly out for out No. 3. Meanwhile, David Price is still going strong, setting down the Royals 1-2-3 in the bottom of the frame. Royals 2, Blue Jays 1.
5th inning - Yordano Ventura issues back-to-back walks to Russell Martin and Kevin Pillar, but the Blue Jays waste a golden opportunity when the next three batters are retired. For the Royals, Alex Rios singles with one out and steals second, but David Price escapes. Royals 2, Blue Jays 1.
4th inning - Jose Bautista gets the Blue Jays on the scoreboard with a one-out solo homer against Yordano Ventura. Chris Colabello singles with two out, but Troy Tulowitzki strikes out looking to end the threat. David Price strikes out the side in the bottom half. Royals 2, Blue Jays 1.
3rd inning - Yordano Ventura again retires the Blue Jays in order. Royals put two on with two outs against David Price, but Eric Hosmer grounds out to end the inning. Royals 2, Blue Jays 0.
2nd inning - Blue Jays go down in order against Yordano Ventura. In the bottom half, Mike Moustakas doubles the Royals' lead with a one-out solo homer off David Price. Royals 2, Blue Jays 0.
1st inning - Blue Jays waste a leadoff double by Ben Revere as Yordano Ventura retires the next three batters. Royals jump out to a 1-0 lead in the bottom half when Ben Zobrist takes David Price deep. It could have been a two-run shot, but Toronto second baseman Ryan Goins made a nice play on a ball hit by Alcides Escobar leading off the inning. Royals 1, Blue Jays 0.
***
PREGAME :
The Toronto Blue Jays and Kansas City Royals resume the best-of-seven American League Championship Series with Friday's Game 6 in Kansas City, where the Royals can punch their ticket to the World Series with another win.
Here are the details:
What : Toronto Blue Jays at Kansas City Royals in ALCS Game 6. Kansas City leads series 3-2.
Where : Kauffman Stadium, Kansas City
When : Friday, October 23, at 5:07 p.m. PT/8:07 p.m. ET
What TV channel : TV on FS1, radio on KMTT (910 AM) in Portland area
Online live stream : Watch online at Fox Sports Go . Listen at ESPNRadio.com .
Live updates : Follow along in the comments section below for live updates during the game
Pitching matchup : Toronto's David Price vs. Kansas City's Yordano Ventura
Playoff schedule : Bookmark our MLB scoreboard for postseason scores and schedules.
